The 'HertzsprungâRussell diagram' is a scatter graph of stars showing the
relationship between the stars' absolute magnitudes or luminosities versus their
spectral types or classifications and effective temperatures.
HertzsprungâRussell diagrams are not pictures or maps of the locations of the
stars. Rather, they plot each star on a graph measuring the star's absolute
magnitude or brightness against its temperature and color.

HertzsprungâRussell diagrams are also referred to by the abbreviation 'HâR
diagram' or 'HRD'. The diagram was created circa 1910 by Ejnar Hertzsprung and
